<Tabs
  groupId="cfc"

  values={[
    { label: "JavaScript", value: "js" },
    { label: "React", value: "react" },

  <TabItem value="js">

You can call methods directly from the InfiniteGrid instance.

```js
const ig = new MasonryInfiniteGrid("#el", options);

ig.getItems();
```

  </TabItem>
  <TabItem value="react">

You can call methods of InfiniteGrid by getting a `ref` of InfiniteGrid

```jsx
import * as React from "react";
import { MasonryInfiniteGrid } from "@egjs/react-infinitegrid";

export default () => {
  const igRef = React.useRef();

  React.useEffect(() => {
    console.log(igRef.current.getItems());
  }, []);
  return <MasonryInfiniteGrid ref={igRef}>
  </MasonryInfiniteGrid>
};
```

See [React Refs and the DOM](https://reactjs.org/docs/refs-and-the-dom.html) for more info.

  </TabItem>
  <TabItem value="vue">

You can access instance of InfiniteGrid component with the [ref](https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/components-edge-cases.html#Accessing-Child-Component-Instances-amp-Child-Elements) property.

```js
<masonry-infinite-grid ref="igRef"></masonry-infinite-grid>
```

Then call methods of it like
```js
this.$refs.igRef.getItems();
```

  </TabItem>
  <TabItem value="vue3">

You can access instance of InfiniteGrid component with the [ref](https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/components-edge-cases.html#Accessing-Child-Component-Instances-amp-Child-Elements) property.

```js
<masonry-infinite-grid ref="igRef"></masonry-infinite-grid>
```

Then call methods of it like
```js
this.$refs.igRef.getItems();
```

  </TabItem>
  <TabItem value="angular">

There're few ways to interact with child component in Angular.
See [Component Interaction](https://angular.io/guide/component-interaction#parent-interacts-with-child-via-local-variable) page from Angular official document, and use that to interact with InfiniteGrid.

```html title="app.component.html"
<div NgxMasonryInfiniteGrid
  #ig
  >
</div>
```

```js title="app.component.ts"
import { Component, Input, AfterViewInit } from '@angular/core';

import { NgxInfiniteGridComponent } from '@egjs/ngx-infinitegrid';
@Component({
  selector: 'app-root',
  templateUrl: './app.component.html',
})
export class AppComponent implements AfterViewInit {
  @ViewChild("ig") ig!: NgxInfiniteGridComponent;
  ngAfterViewInit() {
    console.log(this.ig.getItems());
  }
}
}
```

  </TabItem>
  <TabItem value="svelte">

You can use [bind:this](https://svelte.dev/tutorial/bind-this) syntax of svelte to get the reference of InfiniteGrid.

```jsx
<script lang="ts">
  import { onMount } from "svelte";
  import { MasonryInfiniteGrid } from "@egjs/svelte-infinitegrid";

  let ig;

  onMount(() => {
    console.log(ig.getItems());
  });
</script>
<MasonryInfiniteGrid
  bind:this={ig}
>
</MasonryInfiniteGrid>
```

  </TabItem>
</Tabs>

See all available methods at our <Link to={useBaseUrl("docs/api/InfiniteGrid#methods")}>API</Link> page.
